data.title: Great food, atmosphere and service!
data.text: Another great restaurant that is sure to be a hometown favorite like Zanata in Rockwall.   Excellent beer made on premises and excellent food!   I've been here 3x and each time the food and service have been excellent!   Atmosphere is a mix of modern and vintage.  Awesome!!

data.title: A pub/brewery located in the heart of Rowlett
data.text:
We are not drinkers so a lot of the appeal of Firewheel Brewing was partially lost on us.  On the other hand, it is not a bad place for getting real authentic pub food in a casual friendly atmosphere.  What makes it even better is that it is in the heart of the old city center of Rowlett and is helping to revitalize the area.  For someone getting off DART in Rowlett, it is a short walk to the brewery.  
What brought us to the restaurant was the desire for pub food.  This is definitely the place for it.  We began with the basket of fires and the fried calamari.  Both were pretty good and were more that adequate portions.  We then moved on to the meatloaf.  A very unique hearty meatloaf with lots of spice especially thyme.  A bit too much thyme for us, but we can see how some people would love it. The corn and mashed potatoes were mixed together which was interesting and perfectly in line with pub food.
Service was very friendly

data.title: Hidden Gem Downtown Rowlett...
data.text: This place has awesome menu of a variety of food from very tasty appetizers ,salads ,pizza, hamburgers to hearty entrees! Management and wait staff are friendly fast and fun! Sit at the bar and yoy can watch them cook. Of course the variety of brews will keep  you coming back to try!!  A must go place!

data.title: Great Beer, Food and Atmosphere!
data.text: Great local beer, seriously great! Top 3 of DFW Metroplex easy! Food is superb, from the pizzas to the Brisket Grilled Cheese or even the salads and appetizers. Don't get me started on the Pretzel! All of this plus a great atmosphere both inside and out complete with the bean bag toss. Well done!

data.title: Hidden Gem!
data.text: My husband and I were so delighted to find this restaurant in downtown Rowlett! Good local brews, festive atmosphere and really good food. We tried a pizza and also had the grilled cheese brisket. Loved the crispy sweet potato fries that came with the sandwich!! We will return!

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Stopped in on a Friday. I was disappointed that there was no happy hour on Fridays, only Mon-Thurs.  The prices were good and the beer was good, and cold. The patio area is nice and they offer a good selection of craft beer, along with wine and cocktails. There's construction in the area and not much parking available at the moment. I'm hoping that will change.

data.title: Great beer and really good goid
data.text: Came for an afternoon drink.  Had the flight of beers. They have a very good selection of beers and they will add more variety every week.  This is really good in a brewery which tends to focus on their stalwarts.  The food also was very good -- had the jalapeño poppers and the mussels-- outstanding.  The bar tender, Trace, was very knowledgeable and very attentive.  A good bartender can make or break a place and Trace definitely is one of the best.  Definitely should be added to your list of places to eat and have a beer.

data.title: Love this new Rowlett restaurant!!
data.text:
We were so excited to find this new spot downtown today! The ambience is great and so is the food. We had the jalapeño cheese bread, and a pepperoni pizza, both were awesome.  I tried the tequila cocktail with jalapeños (can't remember the name), it was good but after the first I switched to a margarita on the rocks, which was awesome.

They have an awesome outside patio with games and corn hole.

So glad Rowlett has such an awesome new restaurant, I hope this is the beginning of lots more to come!

data.title: Good Enough Beer.  Good Appetizers.
data.text: I am afraid this is a little bit of a limited review.  After being down for a couple of days after surgery, I just had to get out of the house.  My wife and I had heard about Bankhead and wanted to try it out.  So, mid-afternoon, we dropped in for a beer taster and appetizers.  Pretzel was large, warm and tasty, with sides of beer cheese and spicy mustard.  Definitely fits into the "for sharing" category, unless you just gotta load up on the carbs!  We also tried the sweet potato fries.  Good, if a little overpriced ($7 for an order of fries).    As for the beer, we stuck with the sampler-sized glasses.  Devil Wagon (Helles Lager) was pretty forgetable.  Back Seat Driver (Blonde Ale) was likewise.  The Gussy Up (Raspberry Wheat) was light and tasty, about what you would expect from a wheat.  My wife preferred the Hoofer's Hef (Hefeweizen), while I preferred the Giggle Water (Vienna Lager).   Every thing we saw coming out of the kitchen looked very good.  Good enough that we will be back.

data.title: Great vibe
data.text: This is within walking distance of my house and a much anticipated new vibe and promise of family atmosphere to Main street Rowlett!  The food is great and the beer venue is small for a beer brewery but a great range for beer drinkers alike.  I personally enjoyed the hootenanny, a German bock.  What great promise this place has!

data.title: Great addition to the Downtown Rowlett area!
data.text: We went there for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  We were hoping to sit on their patio, but by the time we got there it was full.  So we sat inside.  Great menu with out of the ordinary offerings and great selection of beers - most of which they brew right there.  Very enjoyable atmosphere and our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful with our questions.  Had a FABULOUS Pumpkin Cheesecake for dessert! Would recommend this place without reservation.

data.title: Step back into the Roaring 20's with thoroughly modern cuisine
data.text: My friends and I had eagerly awaited the opening of the Bankhead Brewing Co., after spotting it as a work-in-progress last year on a trip down the Bankhead Highway in Texas. And when we finally got to come back and enjoy a meal on a crisp early-fall evening, the experience was worth the wait! The dishes and drinks were imaginatively tied to old auto-route experiences. From the BLTA Dip to grilled-cheese-and-brisket-sandwich (with a Texas hard cider) to dessert, every bite was delicious. The decor of this restored industrial building along the Bankhead route through old downtown Roweltt (and these days, right alongside the DART line) make this a warm and welcoming destination. Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Yum!
data.text: We ordered pretzels with cheese for appetizer! I got the brown sugar pizza and other people at my table got the grilled cheese and brisket! I really liked the atmosphere and the food was yummy! We also had really good service! Will have to go back to try more!

data.title: Wonderful meal and brew!
data.text: We were so excited to try the new Bankhead Brewing Company and went early on a Saturday night, just 3 weeks after they opened. Parking is on Main Street and some of the side streets as well. Word of mouth had already spread and we had a 45 minute wait after arriving right at 6:00 p.m. Luckily, there is plenty of outside seating to relax and wait. The new building is beautiful and is well designed with great lighting, modern furniture and fixtures, and lovely stained concrete floors. There is a bar area, tables for two, large tables for four and several large tables for eight to ten people. There is also a nice outside dining area. Several huge windows look out from the dining area into the brewing area. The noise level is high and energetic. Our waiter, Jon, was very personable and helped us order our beef flight. The flight came out in a little metal tray with the names of the five beers written in erasable ink. I found 3 that I really liked! Most of the 4 oz. samples were $2 or $2.50. The dinner menu was quite nice: salads, appetizers, pizza, meat loaf, fish and chips, sandwiches, etc. The pizzas are the wonderful Zanata-style pizza that so many of us are familiar with. The jalapeno cheesy bread was delicious and perfect for sharing. The fish & chips were nice. The brisket grilled cheese was awesome! What a great new addition for downtown Rowlett. Personally, I cannot wait to go back and try some of the other new dishes. Kudos to Kevin and Al for another great hit - you guys know how to do it right! :)

Parking is on Main Street and some of the side streets as well. data.title: I could move to USA for this!
data.text:
I shared a pizza with my friend and it was seriously better then the ones in Italy! My perfect match was "backyard BBQ". Unluckly I'm turning 21 first next week and then I'm already back home in Sweden so I could not try the local beer. But the cocktails and beer are very good (what I was told..).

The restaurant is super nice and homely. You can sit both outside and inside. Food, drinks and personal are very genuine and authentic with this  local production in Rowlett.

Just wish there could be more information about history and the brewing process since it was our first time here.

Also very good price!

data.title: Great new place!
data.text: Had the flight of beers to try them all and was pleased with almost all of them.(not a dark brown fan, personal opinion). Great burger and the bun was outstanding. Fries were good and nice play with seasonings. Know the pizzas are good and that will be next.

data.title: New place, great place!
data.text: Good foods and great new beers. Burger was excellent and no frills. Cheese plate appetizer was good but kinda pricey. Would go back to try a lot more from the menu.

data.title: BEST NEW PLACE ON MAIN STREET DOWNTOWN ROWELTT
data.text: Awesome place.. owners are fantastic.. food is great what a nice place to  eat, visit and hang out with family and friends. Indoor and outdoor seating... Come on over and learn the history behind Bankhead Highway at Bankhead Brewery... amazing brews being served.  You want be disappointed!
